channel.title: Mona Farnisa
channel.description: Geospatial data scientist & analyst — visualizations, spatial statistics, and code.

item.title: Wildfire Resilience Index
item.dc:creator: Mona Farnisa
item.description:
Overview

At the National Center for Ecological Analysis and Synthesis, I worked as a geospatial analyst on the Wildfire Resilience Index, integrating nearly 100 geospatial data layers across multiple domains.

Domains

  • Infrastructure — exposure and capacity
  • Health — population and vulnerability
  • Vegetation & species — fuels and biodiversity
  • Air & water — quality and availability
  • Cultural heritage — nationwide exposure (see Publications)

Tools & methods

  • R, Python, QGIS
  • Spatial aggregation and weighting
  • Deterministic and index-based modeling

Links

  • Wildfire Resilience Index
  • Related publication: Nationwide exposure of United States cultural heritage to wildfire (In Review at Scientific Reports)

item.title: Floral Hemp Nitrogen Fertilization
item.dc:creator: Mona Farnisa
item.description:
Overview

My research in The Sustainable Horticulture Lab at the University of Nevada, Reno focused on plant–environment interactions and fertilization effects on floral hemp under field conditions in the high desert.

Methods

  • Field trials with varying nitrogen regimes
  • Yield and quality metrics
  • Statistical modeling (R)

Publication

Farnisa MM, Miller GC, Solomon JKQ, Barrios-Masias FH (2023) Floral hemp (Cannabis sativa L.) responses to nitrogen fertilization under field conditions in the high desert. PLOS ONE 18(5): e0284537. DOI: 10.1371/journal.pone.0284537

Code & data

Analysis and figures were produced in R. Code and data can be shared on request or via the publication’s supplementary materials.
